content.rendered:
Solution

Cultural Articulation

Define the culture that will in turn define your organisation for years to come – in the eyes of your people and wider stakeholders.
Start Your Journey

What is Cultural Articulation?

Cultural articulation is the process of defining the kind of culture you wish to have, based on your organisation’s history, purpose, values and strategic needs. By distilling this down, you can begin to ask: how much do our current practices reflect the culture we collectively need and desire?

It’s essential to define your desired culture in order to:

  • Cast vision for where your organisation is going
  • Create alignment at all levels of your organisation
  • Identify leadership styles and behaviours that prevent change
  • Identify systems and structures that do not support change

How We Approach Cultural Articulation in Your Organisation

Cultural articulation is part of a whole-business approach that helps you deliver on your organisational strategy. Starting from the inside out, our approach is measured, experiential, and sustainable.

Articulating the Journey-to-Date

Every organisation is already its own kind of miracle, and should be proud of what it has achieved. To move forward, it’s important to look back at where you have come from, find what’s already working, amplify it, and integrate what you have learned with your present challenges and vision.

Articulating Purpose

Your organisation’s purpose is what lends your vision focus and meaning. But if your organisation’s purpose is to be authentic and effective, it can’t be defined entirely from the top. We work with people at all levels of your wider organisation to articulate a purpose that will resonate and inspire.

Articulating Values

Your organisational values lie at the heart of the behaviours and ways of thinking that you want your organisation to embody. But values are only effective when they are clear and can be articulated in a way that can concretely shape your organisation’s structures and systems.

Articulating Key Behaviours and Leadership Models

We’ll use various leadership development frameworks to help you make sense of the leadership behaviours you need and the underlying psychological logic behind them. This will allow your people to identify old patterns of thinking and work to prevent them from undermining your desired culture.

Clarifying the Vision for Change

Vision provides a goal that defines your organisation’s focus. But while leaders don’t need to dictate how that vision should be achieved, the vision cannot afford to be vague or misinterpreted. We work with you to ensure the vision is clear so it can be lived by all.

Get Beneath the Surface of the Problem with Us

At TPC Leadership, we’ve spent over 20 years unraveling why leaders, teams and executives act and think the way they do, as well as co-designing systems that redefine what’s normal for us and our organisations.

Meet Our People

Our professionals draw on a wide range of disciplines – business, education, philosophy, psychology and neuroscience – to support clients all over the world. Many coaches have completed post-graduate studies or are members of psychologist colleges in their own regions. Other professionals have significant business experience gained in organizations around the globe in a variety of sectors.

Research & Insights

Our articles draw on a wealth of frontline experience with corporates, startups, medium-sized companies, non-profits, and public sector organizations across the globe.

Cultivating Work Enjoyment and Psychological Safety

Don’t Go! Retaining Top Talent: 7 Proven Tactics Every Company Should Know

Listening to the quietest voice in the room. A conversation with Rob Shaw, Leading in Operations Programme Manager at BP. EP #10

Stories of Impact

So they are real partners, you really think that you have someone beside you; really diverse team, very able to work with different cultures, very agile; able to cope with ambiguity and complex environments; really able to unleash the potential in individuals, teams and organizations.

Alessandra Stasi, Chief Human Resources Officer

QubicaAMF

What I like about TPCL is that they commit to you. I know that my coach is actively listening. I know that he cares about his clients. I know that he hasn’t lost his appetite, nor his motivation, nor his interest.

David Sloman, Chief Executive

The Royal Free NHS Trust

TPC Leadership develops leaders with a heart for leaders AND their organisations. They are engaged and passionate in what they do. They focus on the individual, but will always keep the vision and objectives of the organisation into account.

Janna Kramer, Learning & Talent Development Leader

EY Netherlands

Very good team results were obtained in the facilitated workshops, creating the environment for knowledge sharing, enhancing collaboration within the executive team, as well as in the coaching and consultancy sessions. We assess that our collaboration has brought consistent and long-term improvement to our organisational performance and culture. As such, we openly recommend TPC Leadership’s services and expertise.

Chief Executive Officer

European NGO

The strength of TPC Leadership that stands out in my opinion is that they bring the most appropriate solutions by recognizing the organization they enter. The fact that the process works smoothly in long-term projects is an important sign that project management is carried out skillfully. I trust them as I would myself.

Necla Aksoy, Assistant General Manager, People & Culture

Sofra Compass Group Türkiye

I would like to thank my TPCL trainer coaches, who enabled me to deepen and internalize what I learned, while providing a wide range of tools that I was able to focus on performance coaching.

Beste Şirin, Beste ŞirinBeste Şirin

Global Cosmetics Retailer

We would like to thank you very much for the interactive online training on Diversity and Inclusion diversified with different examples in our own language by such an experienced team. Getting rid of prejudices, being aware and taking action, understanding the importance of diversity and using inclusive language are the outputs we have received from this training as a team. We have laid the foundation, it’s time to build on it, of course, with the support of the TPCL team.

Berrak Özakman, Manager, Human Resources

Global Luxury Brands Company

Partner With TPC Leadership To Develop and Inspire Your Leaders​

Our diverse team of experts over the globe has over 20 years’ experience of co-designing solutions to complex organizational challenges. Get in touch to see how we can help.
Start Your Journey
